citation.article-title: Lactobacillus diolivorans sp. nov., a 1,2-propanediol-degrading bacterium isolated from aerobically stable maize silage.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus diolivorans sp. nov.
Lactobacillus diolivorans (di.o.li.vo'rans. N.L. diol from 1,2-propanediol; L. v. vorare to devour; N.L. adj. diolivorans devouring diols)
Cells are Gram-positive, non-motile, non-sporeforming rods that occur as single cells, in pairs or occasionally in short chains.
On MRS-MOD medium with 1,2-propanediol as substrate, cells are 1 lm in width and 2 lm in length whereas, on glucose, the cells are longer, up to 10 lm.
Colonies are off-white on MRS medium.
Fermentative growth on 1,2-propanediol under anoxic conditions, producing 1-propanol and propionic acid.
Optimal temperature and pH for growth on 1,2-propanediol are 30-32 °C and pH 5.7.
No growth is obtained at 12 or 42 °C.
Growth at NaCl concentrations of 2%(w/v) at 30 °C; no growth at 4%.
Other phenotypic characteristics of Lactobacillus diolivorans LMG19667T are summarized in Table 2.
The DNA G+C content is 40 mol%.
The type strain is strain JKD6T (=LMG 19667T=DSM 14421T), which was isolated from maize silage in The Netherlands.
